messages: 9575f312bf9f575c44a7c4a8d78d1803 (10:16): sweet enough i got my wifi card working in the jornada but im stuck on wince still :/ ill have to go buy a new cf card and a reader tomorrow to get netbsd on it. still a pretty cool little machine
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (10:19): and I really can't figure out why my kernel won't see my dvd drive
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (10:20): you took somethough out you should not have :)
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (10:20): start again from GENERIC, and be less ruthless
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (10:20): that part I had figure out ;p
542ebcbcf6ee466a1780913e2c800716 (10:25): http://www.microsoft.com/windowsserver2003/ <- 3,400,000,000+ users can't be wrong")
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (10:33): tada, that config works :D
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (10:34): that was from the other boot :/
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:40): im sorry to ask this but.. where can I find what TAGS are available to checkout sources ?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:43): hum src/doc/BRANCHES :)
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (10:51): dynek: what exactly are you looking for?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:59): carneous, Im trying to find what is the difference between the tag netbsd-3 and netbsd-3-0
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (10:59): my guess is that there is no difference as long as 3.1 doesnt exist
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:01): dynek: there is
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:01): netbsd-3 is patches and security updates
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:01): -3-0 is only essential security fixes
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:01): your best bet is to go with netbsd-3
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:01): as it will, at some point, become 3.1
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): or rather, at some point in time, netbsd-3 will be identical to 3.1 release
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:02): I am checking out netbsd-3 at the moment
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): netbsd-3 will continue to receive patches after
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): checking out
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): jesus
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): just grab the bloody tarballs
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): and update
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:02): here
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:03): is there a tarball for every tag ?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:03): dynek: ftp://ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD-daily/netbsd-3/200606090000Z/source/sets
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:03): dynek: grab those, untar them, the cvs update
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:03): dynek: MUCH faster than a checkout, plus you don;t abuse the cvs server
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:04): ok nice
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:04): will do it
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:07): why is there src and syssrc ?
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:07): because some people just want the kernel sources right ?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:07): src is userland
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (11:07): syssrc is kernel
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:07): oh I thought src also had sys
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:07): so I have to download both
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (11:07): but you need src too
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (11:07): since it's the one that includes build.sh
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:19): carneous, thanks for your help. I untared the files. Now I just have to do a cvs up -dP ?
466c8c1fb4fcaa4398b3347fb36f74f0 (11:24): 'morning *
c3771abaa4e03712cd05a81c58bed44c (11:41): carneous, ? :)
